title: Sampling variability in birth sex percentage

content.question: Approximately 52 percent of all recent births were boys. In a simple random sample of 100 recent births, 49 were boys and 51 were girls. The most likely explanation for the difference between the observed results and the expected results in this case is

choices.label: a sampling frame that is incomplete

topic.text: 5.1: Introducing Statistics - Why Is My Sample Not Like Yours?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
